channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: HVM-1: Large-scale video models pretrained with nearly 5000 hours of human-like video data
item.description: We introduce Human-like Video Models (HVM-1), large-scale video models pretrained with nearly 5000 hours of curated human-like video data (mostly egocentric, temporally extended, continuous video recordings), using the spatiotemporal masked autoencoder (ST-MAE) algorithm.

item.title: Automatic Data Labeling for Software Vulnerability Prediction Models: How Far Are We?
item.description: Background: Software Vulnerability (SV) prediction needs large-sized and high-quality data to perform well.

item.title: LoRA-Pro: Are Low-Rank Adapters Properly Optimized?
item.description: Our method constrains the optimization process, shrinking the performance gap between LoRA and full fine-tuning.

item.title: Self-Training with Direct Preference Optimization Improves Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
item.description: We also show that the conventional self-training can be further augmented by a preference learning algorithm called Direct Preference Optimization (DPO).

item.title: HANNA: Hard-constraint Neural Network for Consistent Activity Coefficient Prediction
item.description: We present the first hard-constraint neural network for predicting activity coefficients (HANNA), a thermodynamic mixture property that is the basis for many applications in science and engineering.

item.title: Joint RGB-Spectral Decomposition Model Guided Image Enhancement in Mobile Photography
item.description: The integration of miniaturized spectrometers into mobile devices offers new avenues for image quality enhancement and facilitates novel downstream tasks.

item.title: Text-Driven Neural Collaborative Filtering Model for Paper Source Tracing
item.description: Identifying significant references within the complex interrelations of a citation knowledge graph is challenging, which encompasses connections through citations, authorship, keywords, and other relational attributes.

item.title: MapTune: Advancing ASIC Technology Mapping via Reinforcement Learning Guided Library Tuning
item.description: The effectiveness of MapTune is evaluated on a wide range of benchmarks, different technology libraries and technology mappers.

item.title: Topology-Preserving Downsampling of Binary Images
item.description: We present a novel discrete optimization-based approach to generate downsampled versions of binary images that are guaranteed to have the same topology as the original, measured by the zeroth and first Betti numbers of the black regions, while having good similarity to the original image as measured by IoU and Dice scores.

item.title: MDS-ED: Multimodal Decision Support in the Emergency Department -- a Benchmark Dataset for Diagnoses and Deterioration Prediction in Emergency Medicine
item.description: Methods: We introduce a dataset based on MIMIC-IV, benchmarking protocol, and initial results for evaluating multimodal decision support in the emergency department (ED).

item.title: LKCell: Efficient Cell Nuclei Instance Segmentation with Large Convolution Kernels
item.description: We evaluate our method on the most challenging benchmark and achieve state-of-the-art results (0. 5080 mPQ) in cell nuclei instance segmentation with only 21. 6% FLOPs compared with the previous leading method.

item.title: A Large-Scale Sensitivity Analysis on Latent Embeddings and Dimensionality Reductions for Text Spatializations
item.description: Second, we analyzed the resulting 42817 tabular data points in a descriptive statistical analysis.

item.title: Enhancing Fine-grained Object Detection in Aerial Images via Orthogonal Mapping
item.description: This letter introduces Orthogonal Mapping (OM), a simple yet effective method aimed at addressing the challenge of semantic confusion inherent in FGOD.

item.title: Exploring the Limitations of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks in Classification: Insights to Software Training and Hardware Implementation
item.description: Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KANs), a novel type of neural network, have recently gained popularity and attention due to the ability to substitute multi-layer perceptions (MLPs) in artificial intelligence (AI) with higher accuracy and interoperability.

item.title: Move and Act: Enhanced Object Manipulation and Background Integrity for Image Editing
item.description: However, these methods lack control over the generation position of the edited object and have issues with background preservation.

item.title: Segmentation by registration-enabled SAM prompt engineering using five reference images
item.description: This approach utilises established image registration algorithms to align the new image (to-be-segmented) and a small number of reference images, without requiring segmentation labels.

item.title: Numerical Literals in Link Prediction: A Critical Examination of Models and Datasets
item.description: We propose a methodology to evaluate LP models that incorporate numerical literals.

item.title: Physics-informed nonlinear vector autoregressive models for the prediction of dynamical systems
item.description: Machine learning techniques have recently been of great interest for solving differential equations.

item.title: Very Large-Scale Multi-Agent Simulation in AgentScope
item.description: Recent advances in large language models (LLMs) have opened new avenues for applying multi-agent systems in very large-scale simulations.

item.title: StreamMOS: Streaming Moving Object Segmentation with Multi-View Perception and Dual-Span Memory
item.description: Specifically, we utilize a short-term memory to convey historical features, which can be regarded as spatial prior of moving objects and adopted to enhance current inference by temporal fusion.

item.title: Self-Supervision Improves Diffusion Models for Tabular Data Imputation
item.description: Additionally, the sparsity inherent in tabular data poses challenges for diffusion models in accurately modeling the data manifold, impacting the robustness of these models for data imputation.

item.title: LION: Linear Group RNN for 3D Object Detection in Point Clouds
item.description: To tackle this problem, we simply introduce a 3D spatial feature descriptor and integrate it into the linear group RNN operators to enhance their spatial features rather than blindly increasing the number of scanning orders for voxel features.

item.title: KiVA: Kid-inspired Visual Analogies for Testing Large Multimodal Models
item.description: This paper investigates visual analogical reasoning in large multimodal models (LMMs) compared to human adults and children.

item.title: The Dark Side of Function Calling: Pathways to Jailbreaking Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable capabilities, but their power comes with significant security considerations.

item.title: RefMask3D: Language-Guided Transformer for 3D Referring Segmentation
item.description: 3D referring segmentation is an emerging and challenging vision-language task that aims to segment the object described by a natural language expression in a point cloud scene.

item.title: AsEP: Benchmarking Deep Learning Methods for Antibody-specific Epitope Prediction
item.description: AsEP comes with an easy-to-use interface in Python and pre-built graph representations of each antibody-antigen complex while also supporting customizable embedding methods.

item.title: Analyzing Brain Tumor Connectomics using Graphs and Persistent Homology
item.description: The findings obtained from this study underscore the potential of persistent homology and graph theoretical analysis of the whole-brain connectome in detecting alterations in structural connectivity patterns specific to different types of brain tumors.

item.title: Efficient Inference of Vision Instruction-Following Models with Elastic Cache
item.description: Surrounding less important caches are then merged with these anchors, enhancing the preservation of contextual information in the KV caches while yielding an arbitrary acceleration ratio.

item.title: Cost-effective Instruction Learning for Pathology Vision and Language Analysis
item.description: Here we propose a cost-effective instruction learning framework for conversational pathology named as CLOVER.

item.title: Causal Deepsets for Off-policy Evaluation under Spatial or Spatio-temporal Interferences
item.description: Off-policy evaluation (OPE) is widely applied in sectors such as pharmaceuticals and e-commerce to evaluate the efficacy of novel products or policies from offline datasets.

item.title: How to Train the Teacher Model for Effective Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Recently, it was shown that the role of the teacher in knowledge distillation (KD) is to provide the student with an estimate of the true Bayes conditional probability density (BCPD).

item.title: Keypoint Promptable Re-Identification
item.description: Inspired by recent work on prompting in vision, we introduce Keypoint Promptable ReID (KPR), a novel formulation of the ReID problem that explicitly complements the input bounding box with a set of semantic keypoints indicating the intended target.

item.title: Reshape Dimensions Network for Speaker Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we present Reshape Dimensions Network (ReDimNet), a novel neural network architecture for extracting utterance-level speaker representations.

item.title: Harnessing Temporal Causality for Advanced Temporal Action Detection
item.description: As a fundamental task in long-form video understanding, temporal action detection (TAD) aims to capture inherent temporal relations in untrimmed videos and identify candidate actions with precise boundaries.

item.title: Scaling Training Data with Lossy Image Compression
item.description: In order to capture this trade-off and optimize storage of training data, we propose a `storage scaling law' that describes the joint evolution of test error with sample size and number of bits per image.

item.title: Enhancing Environmental Monitoring through Multispectral Imaging: The WasteMS Dataset for Semantic Segmentation of Lakeside Waste
item.description: This study introduces WasteMS, the first multispectral dataset established for the semantic segmentation of lakeside waste.

item.title: CoMoTo: Unpaired Cross-Modal Lesion Distillation Improves Breast Lesion Detection in Tomosynthesis
item.description: Our framework leverages unpaired mammography data to enhance the training of a DBT model, improving practicality by eliminating the need for mammography during inference.

item.title: Scalify: scale propagation for efficient low-precision LLM training
item.description: Low-precision formats such as float8 have been introduced in machine learning accelerated hardware to improve computational efficiency for large language models training and inference.

item.title: Systematic Reasoning About Relational Domains With Graph Neural Networks
item.description: A common solution is to instead rely on neuro-symbolic methods, which are capable of reasoning in a systematic way by design.

item.title: Towards Neural Network based Cognitive Models of Dynamic Decision-Making by Humans
item.description: We conduct extensive experiments with our two neural network models, IBL, and GPT3. 5, and demonstrate that one of our neural network models achieves the best performance in representing human decision-making.

item.title: Selective Vision-Language Subspace Projection for Few-shot CLIP
item.description: Vision-language models such as CLIP are capable of mapping the different modality data into a unified feature space, enabling zero/few-shot inference by measuring the similarity of given images and texts.

item.title: Large Language Models for Anomaly Detection in Computational Workflows: from Supervised Fine-Tuning to In-Context Learning
item.description: Anomaly detection in computational workflows is critical for ensuring system reliability and security.

item.title: PrevPredMap: Exploring Temporal Modeling with Previous Predictions for Online Vectorized HD Map Construction
item.description: Specifically, the previous-predictions-based query generator is designed to separately encode different types of information from previous predictions, which are then effectively utilized by the dynamic-position-query decoder to generate current predictions.

item.title: LoFormer: Local Frequency Transformer for Image Deblurring
item.description: Due to the computational complexity of self-attention (SA), prevalent techniques for image deblurring often resort to either adopting localized SA or employing coarse-grained global SA methods, both of which exhibit drawbacks such as compromising global modeling or lacking fine-grained correlation.

item.title: Low dimensional representation of multi-patient flow cytometry datasets using optimal transport for minimal residual disease detection in leukemia
item.description: In this paper, we explore statistical learning methods based on optimal transport (OT) to achieve a relevant low-dimensional representation of multi-patient flow cytometry measurements (FCM) datasets considered as high-dimensional probability distributions.

item.title: 3D Gaussian Splatting: Survey, Technologies, Challenges, and Opportunities
item.description: 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) has emerged as a prominent technique with the potential to become a mainstream method for 3D representations.

item.title: dlordinal: a Python package for deep ordinal classification
item.description: dlordinal is a new Python library that unifies many recent deep ordinal classification methodologies available in the literature.

item.title: IgnitionInnovators at "Discharge Me!": Chain-of-Thought Instruction Finetuning Large Language Models for Discharge Summaries
item.description: This paper presents our proposed approach to the Discharge Me!

item.title: Reinforced Prompt Personalization for Recommendation with Large Language Models
item.description: Experimental results demonstrate the superiority of RPP/RPP+ over traditional recommender models, few-shot methods, and other prompt-based methods, underscoring the significance of instance-wise prompting for LLMs in recommendation tasks and validating the effectiveness of RPP/RPP+.

item.title: Uncertainty-Based Ensemble Learning For Speech Classification
item.description: The visualization of the effect of uncertainty and its ensemble learning results show potential improvements in speech classification tasks.
